unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Combining Standard Deviations: Bananas
question_text:
A banana has an average weight of $4$ ounces and a standard deviation of $0.60$ ounces.
What is the standard deviation of the total weight for $3$ bananas?
solution:
The first step in finding the standard deviation of the total weight of the bananas is to find the variance (${ \sigma }^{ 2 }$).

$${ \sigma }_{ 3B }^{ 2 }=({ 0.6 })^{ 2 }+({ 0.6 })^{ 2 }+({ 0.6 })^{ 2 }$$

$$=3({ 0.6 })^{ 2 }$$

$$=1.08 \text{ ounces}$$

The second step is to square root the variance:

$$=\sqrt { 1.08 } $$

$$=1.04 \ \text{ ounces}$$

Choice 'C' is our answer.

Explanation of Distractors Choice 'A' represents the variation being divided by three. Choice 'B' represents the standard deviation being added three times and then being divided by three. This is an incorrect method. Choice 'D' is incorrect as this is the variation of the total weight of the three bananas. Choice 'E' represents the standard deviation being added three times which is an incorrect method.
